slides.title: Welcome to Veridian
slides.description: Take full control of your digital identity with secure and seamless management

slides.title: Secure and Self-Sovereign
slides.description: Your identity is encrypted and stored safely on your device. Only you have access

slides.title: Privacy First
slides.description: Control when to present your credentials, keeping your personal data private

slides.title: Sign with Group Identity
slides.description: Sign and verify as an individual or part of a group, whenever needed

setpasscode.description: Create a passcode to secure your wallet and to continue the onboarding process
setpasscode.recoverydescription: Create a passcode to secure your wallet and to continue the recovery process

setupbiometrics.title: Enable biometrics
setupbiometrics.description: Use biometrics for quicker access to your Veridian wallet. You can turn this on or off anytime in settings.

paragraph.bottom: Keep these words safe! Store them securely and never share them with anyone.

recoveryseedphrasedocs.title: Recovery phrase
recoveryseedphrasedocs.alert: We can’t recover your wallet if you lose your recovery phrase. Keeping it safe means keeping your identity safe.

content.text: Your recovery phrase is like a master key for your wallet. It’s a unique set of 18 words that lets you securely access your identity wallet—even if you lose your phone or need to restore it on a new device.
Your wallet, your control: Unlike traditional accounts, no one—not even us—can reset your wallet for you. This keeps your identity and data secure and fully under your control.
One-of-a-kind key: The recovery phrase is the only way to restore your wallet if something happens to your device. Without it, you could permanently lose access to your identity.
Stay protected: Think of it like a spare key to your house. If you lose it, no one can unlock the door—even you!
Write it down: Store it somewhere secure, like a locked drawer or safe.
Don’t share it: Anyone with your recovery phrase can access your wallet. Keep it private.
No screenshots: Don’t save it on your phone or in the cloud—this protects it from hackers.

overlay.text: Press the ‘view recovery phrase’ button when you’re ready to see your recovery phrase. Remember to make sure nobody is looking!

confirm.text: Have you double-checked you’ve copied your 18 word phrase correctly?

exit.text: If you go back you will lose your current progress. Are you sure you want to do this?

toggle.text: Switching tabs will remove the words you have already entered, are you sire you want to switch?

verify.text: Your recovery phrase couldn’t be verified. Please, try again or choose an alternative method

termsandconditions.text: I have read and agree to the <0>{{clickableTerms}}</0> and <1>{{clickablePrivacy}}</1>.

intro.title: Terms of Use
intro.text:
These Terms of Use set forth the legally binding terms and conditions for your use of the Veridian wallet (“Veridian”). Veridian is a decentralized identity management application developed by the Cardano Foundation (Cardano Stiftung) (the “Foundation”), which enables you to generate, manage, and control your digital identity through cryptographic keys and verifiable credentials using the Key Event Receipt Infrastructure (KERI) protocol.

Please read these Terms carefully. By accessing or using Veridian, you agree to be bound by these Terms, including any additional guidelines or rules referenced herein. If you do not agree to these Terms, please do not use Veridian.

content.subtitle: 1. Eligibility
content.text: By using Veridian, you represent and warrant that you are of legal age to form a binding contract in your jurisdiction, and have not previously been suspended or removed from using Veridian. If you are using Veridian on behalf of a legal entity, you further represent and warrant that (i) the entity is duly organized under applicable laws, and (ii) you are duly authorized to act on its behalf.

content.subtitle: 2.1. Licence Grant
content.text: The Cardano Foundation grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable licence to access and use Veridian for your digital identity management purposes, subject to these terms.

content.subtitle: 2.2. Restrictions on Use
content.text: You agree not to:
nested: Modify, distribute, or create derivative works based on Veridian.
Compromise the security or integrity of the Wallet or its underlying systems.
Use Veridian for any unlawful or unauthorised purpose.

content.subtitle: 3. User Responsibilities
content.text: You are responsible for:

content.subtitle: 3.1. Security of Digital Identity
content.text: Maintaining the security and confidentiality of your passwords, cryptographic keys, digital identity (AID), and any credentials generated or stored in Veridian. Loss or compromise of this information may result in irrecoverable loss of access to your digital identity.

content.subtitle: 3.2. Associated information, Credentials
content.text: The accuracy and maintenance of any optional information you choose to bind or associate with your digital identity.

content.subtitle: 3.3. Compliance with Laws
content.text: Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations when using Veridian.

content.subtitle: 4. Intellectual property
content.text: All intellectual property rights in and to Veridian, including its design, features, and underlying technology, are owned by the Cardano Foundation or its licensors. Nothing in these Terms grants you any right or license to use any trademark, logo, or service mark displayed in Veridian without the prior written consent of the Cardano Foundation.

content.subtitle: 5. Third Party Services
content.text: Veridian may interface with third-party services (such as cloud agents or blockchain networks) to provide its functionality. The Cardano Foundation is not responsible for the performance or reliability of these third-party services, and your use of such services is governed by their respective terms and policies.

content.subtitle: 6.1. Disclaimer of Warranties
content.text: Veridian is provided on an “as is” and “as available” basis without warranties of any kind, either express or implied. The Foundation makes no representations and expressly disclaims all warranties about the suitability, merchantability, fitness for purpose, reliability, availability, timeliness, security, title and non-infringement, accuracy or completeness, data synched to or made available from the products, product content, or any consulting services we provide for any associated purpose.

content.subtitle: 6.2. No Indirect Damages
content.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Foundation shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, consequential, punitive, or special damages (including loss of profits, revenue, or data) arising out of your use of Veridian.

content.subtitle: 6.3. Limitation of Liability
content.text: The aggregate liability of the Foundation, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise, is limited to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law. In any event, if fees have been paid for use of Veridian, our total liability shall not exceed the total amounts paid in the twelve months preceding the claim. If no fees are payable, our liability will be limited to one hundred US Dollars.

content.subtitle: 7. Indemnification
content.text: You agree to fully indemnify, defend and hold the Foundation Entities, including their directors, officers, employees, consultants, and other representatives, harmless from and against any claims, damages, losses, costs (including reasonable legal fees), and other expenses resulting directly or indirectly from: (a) any breach or noncompliance of these Terms of Use by you or your affiliates, inclusive of policies mentioned herein; (b) allegations that materials you provide or convey to the Products violate the intellectual property rights of a third party; (c) your or your affiliates' use of Third-Party Products; and/or (d) any negligent or intentional misconduct by you. You shall not agree to any settlement that (i) obligates Us in any manner; (ii) demands an admission from Us; or (iii) assigns liability beyond these indemnifications or restricts Us, without obtaining Our prior written approval.

content.subtitle: 8.1. Service Changes
content.text: We reserve the right to modify, update, limit, or revoke your access to Veridian at any time, for any reason, without prior notice, at our sole discretion.

content.subtitle: 8.2. Privacy Policy
content.text: By using Veridian, you acknowledge that our <0>{{PrivacyPolicy}}</0> applies to you, and your continued use constitutes acceptance of the <0>{{PrivacyPolicy}}</0>.

content.subtitle: 8.3. Feedback
content.text: We welcome your feedback and suggestions regarding Veridian, and you can provide your thoughts at <1>{{VeridianSupport}}</1>. By providing feedback, you grant us permission to use, share, and build upon your input without any obligation or compensation to you.

content.subtitle: 8.4. Amendments
content.text: We may modify these Terms at any time. The revised version will become effective on the next business day after posting. Your continued use of Veridian constitutes your acceptance of the modified Terms. If you do not agree with any changes, you must notify us in writing within thirty (30) days of notice.

content.subtitle: 8.5. Assignment
content.text: You may not assign, transfer, or sublicense your rights or obligations under these Terms without our prior written consent. We may assign or transfer our rights at our discretion.

content.subtitle: 8.6. Waiver and Severability
content.text: Our failure to enforce any provision of these Terms shall not constitute a waiver of that provision. If any provision is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.

content.subtitle: 8.7. Application Provider Terms
content.text: These Terms of Use are between you and the Foundation only, and not with an application service or application platform provider (such as Apple, Inc., or Google Inc.), which may provide you the Veridian wallet application subject to their own terms of use.

content.subtitle: 8.8. Entire Agreement
content.text: These Terms constitute the entire agreement between you and the Cardano Foundation regarding your use of Veridian and supersede all prior communications, agreements, and understandings.

content.subtitle: 8.9. Disputes
content.text: If you have a dispute with the Foundation or a claim to raise in relation to Veridian, you agree to contact us using the form at <1>{{VeridianSupport}}</1> to attempt to resolve the issue informally first.

content.subtitle: 8.10. Survival
content.text: The provisions relating to disclaimers, limitations of liability, indemnification, governing law, and any other provisions intended to survive termination shall continue to apply after termination of your use of Veridian.

content.subtitle: 9.1. Governing Law
content.text: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Switzerland.

content.subtitle: 9.2. Jurisdiction
content.text: Any disputes arising out of or in connection with these Terms that are not resolved through informal dispute resolution set forth in section 8.9 shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Zug, Switzerland.

content.subtitle: 10. Contact us
content.text:
If you have any questions, concerns, or feedback regarding these Terms, please contact us at:

Cardano Foundation,
Dammstrasse 16,
6300, Zug,
Switzerland
Attn: Legal

link.federaldataprotection: Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner

content.subtitle: 1. Introduction
content.text: Cardano Foundation (Cardano Stiftung) is a not-for-profit organisation based in Zug, Switzerland tasked with advancing the Cardano blockchain as a public infrastructure across a wide range of industries. Our registered address is: Cardano Stiftung, Dammstrasse 16, 6300 Zug, Switzerland.

content.subtitle: 2. Scope of this Privacy Policy
content.text:
This Privacy Policy specifically applies to the decentralised identity solution developed by the Cardano Foundation known as Veridian.  Veridian is designed using the Key Event Receipt Infrastructure (KERI) protocol to provide identity management services to users worldwide (the “Services”).

Veridian is comprised of multiple integrated components, which operate in two distinct environments: (collectively “Veridian”):
nested: Production Environment This is the live, operational system where real users generate and manage their digital identities (AIDs) and credentials. Infrastructure and tooling in the production environment are not hosted on our infrastructure.

Sandbox Environment This is a non-production, containerized environment hosted on the Cardano Foundation’s on-premise servers, provided solely for testing, evaluation, and demonstration purposes. The Sandbox includes a version of our credential management tooling (which is open source and available on GitHub) that is limited to testing use and is not intended for production or commercial use. Access to the Sandbox is granted via a request process and is governed by separate terms.

content.text: The integrated components of Veridian include:
nested: Wallet (Edge Agent) The Veridian wallet is the user-facing application that aggregates, displays, and allows you to manage your digital identity credentials. Through the wallet, you generate your digital identifier (the “AID”), control it with cryptographic keys, approve or decline identity-related requests, and decide when and how your credentials are shared. Infrastructure This comprises production cloud agents, independent Witnesses, Cardano Services, and other supporting systems that securely relay and verify your encrypted data. Credential Management Tooling A suite of tools that facilitate the creation, issuance, verification, and revocation of digital credentials. Browser Extension A browser extension that leverages the KERI and ToIP ACDC protocols for enhanced identity management and verifiable data.

content.text: This privacy policy (“Policy”) explains and sets out the basis for why and when we collect, use, store, and share personal information of people who use the Veridian Services, and/ or interact with us in any other way related thereto. It explains and sets out how we collect and use personal data, the conditions under which we may disclose it to others and the measures we take to keep it secure. If you transmit or disclose data about other persons such as family members, employees, work colleagues, etc., we assume that you are authorized to do so, that this data is correct and that we may process it as described here. By transmitting such data, you confirm this. Please also ensure that these third parties have been informed of this Policy. We may amend this Policy from time to time so please check it occasionally to ensure that you are aware of any changes.

content.subtitle: 3. How you can contact us
content.text:
Please use the following contact information to report any concerns related to data protection:
FAO: Cardano Stiftung, Rykestraße 26, 10405 Berlin, Germany
privacy@cardanofoundation.org

content.subtitle: 4. How we collect information about you
content.text: Veridian is designed with ‘privacy by design’ in mind. We aim to process only the minimum data necessary to deliver our Services securely. We do not collect any personal information at registration. You are not required to provide conventional personal details to access the Services, such as your name, email address, phone number, photograph, date of birth, and similar information related to your business, its employees, officers, representatives, or affiliates. Instead, Veridian allows you to generate a unique cryptographic identity (AID) that is entirely under your control.
You are not obliged to disclose your personal data to us. However, we may collect and process the following types of information about you:

content.subtitle: 4.1. Information you provide us
content.text:
You may provide us with personal information by contacting user support, or by corresponding with us by e-mail, web form, live chat, phone, letter or other means of communication. We collect the data exchanged between you and us, including your contact details and the marginal data of the communication.  Any personal information you choose to share is retained solely for the purpose of resolving your query.

Additionally, you may provide personal information when registering to participate in the Sandbox environment. This data will be used only for granting you access to the Sandbox and delivering the associated services.

content.subtitle: 4.2. Technical Data for Service Functionality
content.text: In the production environment, technical data required for secure operation typically remains on your device and is not collected by us. However, as part of our mobile security tooling, limited anonymous diagnostic data (as described in Section 4.3) may be transmitted off-device via the freeRASP SDK to support runtime protection and threat detection.

content.subtitle: 4.3. Diagnostic Data
content.text: To enhance fraud prevention and user safety, the Veridian wallet integrates the freeRASP SDK (provided by Talsec). This SDK collects a limited set of anonymous diagnostic data off-device solely for security threat detection.
nested: Category: Application Info and Performance Diagnostics: Information about the integrity of the app and the operating system (e.g., rooting, emulator usage, presence of hooking frameworks)

Category: Device and Other Identifiers Device-related data: Anonymous device model and hashed identifiers to ensure that the app instance is running on the originally installed device. This is used to prevent threats such as bot abuse or API misuse.

content.subtitle: 4.4. Data Collection in the Sandbox Environment
content.text: For users accessing the Sandbox environment—a controlled, non-production testing environment hosted on our on-premise servers—we expect that fictitious data will be used. The Sandbox is intended solely for evaluation and testing purposes, and real personal data should not be processed. All data collected or processed in the Sandbox environment is segregated from production data and will be securely destroyed once the testing engagement concludes.

content.subtitle: 4.5. Information we receive from other sources
content.text: Veridian does not actively aggregate data from third-party sources. Should any additional information be received (for example, through optional integrations), it is processed only to the extent necessary for the intended functionality and under strict confidentiality.

content.subtitle: 5. How your information is used
content.text: We may use personal information about you for the following purposes:
nestednumeric: to manage relationships with suppliers and fulfil contractual obligations (Article 6 para 1 letters a and b GDPR if applicable);

to send you personalised communications which you have requested and that may be of interest to you, which may be based on your activity on our Website or the website of our partners. These may include information, suggestions and recommendations about new offers, campaigns, activities and events (Article 6 para 1 letters a and b GDPR if applicable);
to understand and measure the effectiveness of how we serve you and others (Article 6 para 1 letters b and f GDPR if applicable);

to ensure compliance with legal obligations and official orders, including communication with authorities and courts; enforcement of and defence against legal claim (Article 6 para 1 letter f GDPR if applicable).

content.subtitle: 6. Security and Data Integrity
content.text: Veridian employs robust security measures to ensure your digital identity, and any personal information that you have bound to it, remains secure and fully under your control:

content.subtitle: 6.1. Local Data Management
content.text: Most operations—including key generation, authentication, and signing—occur directly on your device via the mobile edge agent. Sensitive details (such as your application password or a label you assign to your digital identity) are stored locally using advanced encryption and secure enclave technologies.

content.subtitle: 6.2. Encryption
content.text: Any data transmitted externally—whether for credential issuance, verification, or other interactions—is encrypted at the edge (ie. on your device) before being sent to the cloud agent or third parties.

content.subtitle: 6.3. Cloud Agent Selection
content.text: You have full control over selecting the cloud agent infrastructure that best suits your needs, for transmitting encrypted messages;. In the production environment, the Cardano Foundation does not currently host any cloud agents on its own servers, while in the Sandbox environment,  you have the option to use non-production cloud agents hosted on Cardano Foundation’s infrastructure or deploy your own cloud agent on your own infrastructure..

content.subtitle: 6.4. Verifiable Credentials/ Personal Information
content.text: You may optionally choose to bind personal information (such as university degrees or passports) to your AID. While you control this data through the Veridian wallet, the information itself is stored with the independent cloud agent.

content.subtitle: 6.5. Controlled Data Sharing
content.text: Your device acts as the primary data controller. Identity data exchanges occur only with your explicit consent and include only the information you choose to share.

content.subtitle: 6.6. Decentralised Verification
content.text: Each AID is supported by a Key Event Log (KEL) managed within the IDW app. When you rotate your keys or sign an event, the updated KEL is transmitted to your chosen cloud agent, where independent third-party Witnesses verify the change. This verification process generates a Key Event Receipt Log (KERL), a tamper-proof record of the event. The Witnesses then submit the KERL to Cardano nodes, which store it on the Cardano blockchain to ensure its integrity. In addition, global monitoring services—referred to as Global Watchers—can access these KERLs to verify the cryptographic authenticity of your AID, ensuring that outdated or compromised keys are not used.

content.subtitle: 7. Who has access to your information
content.text:
We do not pass on personal data to third parties without the consent of the person concerned, unless this is necessary for the purposes described in this Policy and except to third parties such as service providers, agents, subcontractors and other associated organisations engaged by us for processing for the purposes of completing tasks and providing services to you on our behalf, or if we are legally obliged to do so or if it is necessary to protect our interests, e.g. to combat abuse or to protect the law, to authorities or other third parties and within the framework of tracking technologies as described in this Policy.
If we use third party service providers, we disclose only the personal information that is necessary to deliver the service and we have a contract in place that requires them to keep your information secure.

content.subtitle: 8. Where we store your personal information
content.text:
The data that we collect from you may be transferred to, and stored in, a country outside the European Economic Area (EEA), i.e. worldwide, in particular Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the USA. The laws in some countries may not provide the same legal protection for your information as in the EEA. In these cases, we only transfer personal data after we have implemented the legally required measures, such as the conclusion of standard contractual clauses on data protection or obtaining the consent of the data subjects. If you are interested, the documentation on these measures can be obtained from the address mentioned above. 
We will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Policy.
The transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we will do our best to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee the security of your information; any transmission is at your own risk. Once we have received your information, we will use good procedures and strong security features to try to prevent unauthorised access.

content.subtitle: 9. How long will we keep your data
content.text: We will hold your personal information on our systems for as long as is necessary for the relevant activity. They are then either deleted or anonymized, unless we need them for longer in exceptional cases, e.g. due to statutory retention and documentation obligations or our legitimate interests, e.g. to protect rights to which we are entitled or to defend against claims.

content.subtitle: 10. Security measures to protect your information
content.text:
We take appropriate administrative, technical and physical safeguards to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of personal data. We use strict procedures and security features, including encryption techniques, and take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that personal data is processed securely and in accordance with this Policy.
Non-sensitive details such as your email address may be transmitted unencrypted over the Internet, and so may not be guaranteed to be 100% secure. While we strive to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee the security of any information you transmit to us, and you do so at your own risk.

content.subtitle: 11. Your choices and your rights
content.text: If you choose to provide any personal data (for example, during support interactions or optional features), you retain the following rights under applicable data protection laws (such as the GDPR):
nested: Right of Access: You may request a copy of any personal data we hold about you.
Right to Rectification: If any personal data is inaccurate or incomplete, you can request its correction.
Right to Erasure: You may request the deletion of your personal data when it is no longer necessary for our purposes.
Right to Restrict Processing: You can ask us to limit the processing of your personal data under certain circumstances.
Right to Data Portability: You have the right to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
Right to Object: You may object to the processing of your personal data, including for direct marketing purposes.

content.text:
You have the right to request a copy of your personal data as well as the right to have your personal data corrected or deleted.
You have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent data protection authority. The competent data protection authority in Switzerland is the <2>{{Federal}}</2>. Competent data protection authorities of EU countries can be accessed through this <3>{{Link}}</3>.

content.subtitle: 12. Review of this Policy
content.text:
We periodically review and update this Privacy Policy to ensure it remains current with our practices and legal obligations. Any material changes will be communicated through the Veridian Wallet application. We encourage you to review this Policy regularly.

Last updatedMarch 2025
The Cardano Foundation Identity Wallet requires connecting to a Cloud Agent, securely controlled by the keys on your mobile device.
As part of the Identity Wallet onboarding process a Boot URL and a Connect URL must be provided to establish the secure connection between the edge and the cloud.
Recovering your Identity Wallet requires re-establishing an existing connection to your Cloud Agent using the Connect URL.
Upon successful reconnecting the Identity Wallet will begin re-syncing with the cloud agent to complete recovery of identifiers and credentials.

lockpage.title: Welcome back
lockpage.description: Please enter your passcode to login

text.verify: If you've forgotten your passcode, please verify your recovery phrase to gain access to your wallet
text.restart: You currently haven't generated a recovery phrase, would you like to start your onboarding again?

paragraph.top: Please select each word in the order it was presented to you.

fail.text: Sorry, the recovery phrase you have entered is incorrect!

exit.text: If you go back you will lose your current progress. Are you sure you want to do this?

clear.text: Are you sure you want to clear all the words you have entered so far?

paragraph.top: Please verify your recovery phrase to recover your wallet. To start typing click on the first option.

suggestions.title: Suggestions
suggestions.error: All words must be compatible with the suggestions

fail.text: Sorry, the recovery phrase you have entered is incorrect!

clear.text: Are you sure you want to clear all the words you have entered so far?

recovery.title: Switch to recover an existing wallet
recovery.paragraphtop: You're about to switch to the wallet recovery process. Here's what will happen:

warning.one: Passcode & Operations Password: You'll keep your existing passcode and operations password. If you chose to skip setting an operations password, that preference will remain.
warning.two: Recovery Phrase: If you've gone beyond the generation of a new recovery phrase, this will be wiped. You'll need to verify the recovery phrase associated with your previous wallet.
warning.three: Connect URL: You will only need the Connect URL for the SSI agent screen.

recovery.paragraphbot: When you switch, you'll be able to enter your recovery details to access your existing wallet.

create.title: Switch to create a new wallet
create.paragraphtop: You're about to switch to the new wallet creation process. Here's what will happen:

warning.one: Passcode & Operations Password: You'll keep your existing passcode and operations password. If you chose to skip setting an operations password, that preference will remain.
warning.two: Recovery Phrase: You'll need to generate a recovery phrase and copy these words down somewhere safe
warning.three: Boot URL and Connect URL: You will need both your Boot URL and Connect URL for the SSI agent screen.

create.paragraphbot: When you switch, you'll start the process to create a brand new wallet.

createpassword.title: Create password
createpassword.description: Add an extra layer of security for sensitive actions in your wallet by creating an optional password.

alert.text: Are you sure you want to skip? By doing this, you will be required to use your passcode for any protected operations. You can, of course, set this up later if you prefer.

error.hasSpecialChar: Use only lowercase/uppercase letters, numbers & symbols for your password.
error.hintSameAsPassword: Your hint cannot be your password

acceptcriteria.text: Must be between 8-64 characters, contain a lowercase and uppercase letter, a number, and a symbol.

symbolmodal.title: Symbol guide
symbolmodal.text: Please ensure the symbols you’re using in your password align with the standard US and UK keyboards listed below:
symbolmodal.note: Various operating systems and applications may apply limitations to this set.
symbolmodal.name: Name

setuppassword.title: Create a password
setuppassword.description: Add extra protection for sensitive actions. If you skip this for now, your PIN will be used instead — you can always set a password later.

ssiagent.title: Enter your SSI agent details
ssiagent.description: To continue, please enter the SSI agent boot and connect URLs (in your email or from your command line).
ssiagent.verifydescription: To continue, please enter the SSI agent connect URL (in your email or from your command line).

boot.label: Boot URL
boot.placeholder: Paste or scan your boot URL

connect.label: Connect URL
connect.placeholder: Paste or scan your connect URL

error.mismatchconnecturl: This connect URL doesn’t match the boot URL
error.recoverymismatchconnecturl: Please check this connect URL matches the original boot URL used for onboarding and that your agent is still active
error.unknownissue: We could not reach this server. Either the server is down, you have entered an incorrect URL or you have internet connectivity issues.

filters.placeholder: You haven’t created any {{ type }} identifiers yet.

welcome.text: You're in the perfect spot to create your secure and private digital identity. Let's begin by adding your first identifier!

deletepending.title: Identifier options
deletepending.description: Your identifier is pending and may still complete. If you no longer require this identifier, tap “Delete identifier” to remove it.
deletepending.mutilsigdescription: This multi-sig is pending. It will complete once it meets the required member threshold. To remove it from your pending list, tap “Delete identifier”.
deletepending.witnesserror: There was an issue creating this identifier. Please contact your cloud provider for more information. To remove it from your pending list, tap “Delete Identifier”.
deletepending.secondchecktitle: Are you sure you want to delete this identifier?

alert.title: Are you sure you want to delete this identifier?

rotatekeys.message: After rotating your keys, you may experience some delays when using this identifier for a short period.
rotatekeys.description: Rotating your signing keys boosts security by reducing the risk of key compromise.

details.clouderror:
We couldn’t locate this identifier in the cloud. It might become available again soon, but some information could be lost.

If you no longer require this identifier, tap “Delete identifier” to remove.

propexplain.title: About advanced details
propexplain.content: Provides additional details on this identifier for users interested in more technical insights.

propexplain.title: About signing threshold
propexplain.content: Minimum number of signing keys required to approve a transaction or event within the identifier.

propexplain.title: About rotation threshold
propexplain.content: The minimum number of new keys required to rotate and replace old signing keys.

propexplain.title: About group members
propexplain.content: Displays the list of individuals or entities that jointly control this group identifier.

tab.title: Credentials
tab.placeholder: No credentials yet. They will appear here once a connection issues them.

filters.placeholder: You currently have no {{ type }} credentials.

deletepending.title: Credential options
deletepending.description: Your credential is pending and may still complete. If you no longer require this credential, tap “Delete credential” to remove it.
deletepending.secondchecktitle: Are you sure you want to delete this credential?

attributes.title: Credential attributes
attributes.label: Attributes
attributes.description: Essential details shared by the issuer, which verify and describe key information in this credential.

archive.title: Are you sure you want to archive this credential?

delete.title: Are you sure you want to delete this credential?

restore.title: Are you sure you want to view this with your other credentials?

missingissuer.text: This credential was issued through a connection that has since been deleted or is no longer accessible. As a result, the connection details cannot be displayed.

details.clouderror:
We couldn’t locate this credential in the cloud. It might become available again soon, but some information could be lost.

If you no longer require this credential, tap “Delete credential” to remove.

alert.title: Once this credential is visible you'll receive a notification. Until then you won't be able to access more details.

restoresingle.title: Are you sure you want to view this with your other credentials?

restoremultiple.title: Are you sure you want to view these with your other credentials?

deletesingle.title: This will delete the selected credential from your wallet permanently

deletemultiple.title: This will delete the selected credentials from your wallet permanently

tab.title: Align the QR code within the frame to scan
tab.permissionalert: Enable the camera in your device settings to start scanning
tab.cameraunavailable: We're unable to access your camera.

missingidentifier.title: To establish a connection you will need to create an identifier

unknownissuer.text: Someone is trying to issue you a credential. Ensure your connections are set up to accept it.

unknownrequest.text: Someone is requesting a credential from you. Ensure your connections are set up to accept it.

deletealert.text: Deleting this notification cannot be undone. Once deleted you will no longer be able to require any actions required from this notification.

labels.exnipexgrant: {{connection}} wants to issue you a credential
labels.multisigicp: {{connection}} is requesting to create a group identifier with you
labels.exnipexapply: {{connection}} has requested a credential from you
labels.exnipexapplyproposed: {{initiator}} has proposed a credential for the {{connection}}’s request
labels.connectinstructions: Check your email for instructions on how to connect with {{connection}}

alert.text: You don’t have any credentials available that match this request. In order to offer this credential you will need to acquire one first.

information.title: Credential request

alert.textdecline: Are you sure you want to decline this credential request? You won't be able to change your decision later.

information.reachthreshold: The threshold has been met, and your group has agreed to your proposed credential presentation.
information.initiatorselectcred: As the group initiator, you'll select the credential to present. Once chosen, the rest of the group will be notified and asked to approve or decline the selection.
information.initiatorselectedcred: You've already proposed a credential for this request. It will be sent once the group’s threshold is met.
information.memberreviewcred: The group initiator has proposed a credential to present for a recent request. Please review the proposal and choose to accept or reject it.
information.memberwaitingproposal: The group initiator will propose a credential to present. Once chosen, the you and the rest of the group will be notified and asked to approve or decline the selection.
information.memberjoined: Your response has been recorded. Please check back for updates.
information.missingproposedcredential: The proposed credential has either not yet been accepted in your wallet or you have since deleted it.
information.initiatordeletedproposedcredential: You have deleted this credential from your wallet since proposing this.

choosecredential.description: Below is a list of all '{{requestCred}}' credentials, ordered by the name of the issuer
choosecredential.title: Choose credential
choosecredential.disclaimer: The below credentials are revoked and may not be accepted by the verifier.

receive.title: Receive credential
receive.revokedalert: This credential has been revoked by the issuer and is no longer available.
receive.initiatoracceptedalert: Your group is receiving a credential. Once the group initiator accepts it, you’ll be able to accept yours too.

alert.textdecline: Are you sure you want to decline this credential issuance? You won't be able to change your decision later.

identifier.title: Identifier request
identifier.subtitle: You have received a request to join a group identifier

alert.textdecline: Are you sure you want to decline this request? You won't be able to change your decision later.

missingissuer.text: This credential was issued through a connection that has since been deleted or is no longer accessible. As a result, the connection details cannot be displayed.

errorpage.title: Please review
errorpage.alerttext: You are missing one or more connections required for this group request. Please scan all necessary QR codes to proceed.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.detailtext: In order to continue and complete the group setup, please follow the instructions below.
instructions.stepone: Ensure you have scanned all participant's QR codes.
instructions.steptwo: After scanning, try to open this notification again.

help.title: Need help?
help.detailtext: If you need assistance, please message us on our <0>{{discordSupportChannel}}</0>.

description.paragraphone: The certificate for {{certificate}} is still awaiting a signature from the other party. This step may take up to 7 days.
description.paragraphtwo: If the signature isn't received within this period, the certificate will be finalized without their participation.
description.paragraphthree: No action is required from you at this time.

connectinstructions.title: Instructions
connectinstructions.subtitle: Connect with {{connection}}
connectinstructions.description: You should have received an email explaining how to create a connection between your wallet and with the {{connection}} team.

steps.one: Open the email subject “Connect with {{connection}} via your Identity Wallet”
steps.two: Find the QR code within the email
steps.three: Open the scanner using the button at the bottom of this notification or from the wallet’s navigation tab
steps.four: Scan the QR code or paste the Connection ID and advance

biometricsalert.message: In order to use biometrics you need to enable this in your settings. Would you like to do this?

changepin.title: Change passcode
changepin.description: Create a new passcode to secure your wallet

alert.enablemessage: By turning on an operations password you will be required to use this to verify any future operations instead of your passcode.
alert.disablemessage: By turning off your operations password you will be required to use your passcode to verify any future operations.
alert.existingpassword: Your new operations password must be different to your existing one.

page.title: Recovery phrase

tips.label: Useful tips:
tips.one: Write down or make a copy of your recovery phrase and store it in a safe location.
tips.two: Double-check that your words are copied in the correct order (1 to 18).
tips.three: Ensure there are no spelling errors.

page.hiddentext: Press the ‘view recovery phrase’ button when you’re ready to see your recovery phrase. Remember to make sure nobody is looking!

confirmmodal.title: Stay safe
confirmmodal.subtitle: Confirm and acknowledge the following:
confirmmodal.firstcondition: Nobody else can see my screen
confirmmodal.secondcondition: Sharing my recovery phrase with others puts my identity at risk
confirmmodal.thirdcondition: Losing my recovery phrase means I will lose access to my wallet

alert.title: This will delete all wallet data. You can restore your account anytime with your secret recovery phrase.

disconnectbeforecreatealert.message: You are currently connected. To connect with a new wallet, you will be disconnected from your current selection. Would you like to disconnect and continue?

connectionbrokenalert.message: Your connection has been disconnected as you have deleted the chosen identifier paired with this connection. Please choose a new identifier to re-establish this connection.

deletealert.message: Are you sure you want to delete this connection?

missingidentifieralert.message: To connect with Cardano, you need to create an individual identifier. Would you like to create one now?

stageone.title: Connect Cardano
stageone.message: Would you like to establish a CIP-45 Connection?

alert.titleconfirm: Are you sure you want to decline this connection?

stagetwo.title: Choose identifier
stagetwo.message: Which individual identifier would you like to make the connection with?

noresult.title: No results for “{{keyword}}”
noresult.text: Check the spelling or try a new search

indentifierselector.title: Choose identifier
indentifierselector.message: Which identifier would you like to make the connection with?

alert.message: To create a connection, you need to create an identifier. Would you like to create one now?

deletepending.title: Connection options
deletepending.description: This connection is pending. You’ll be notified once they accept. If you no longer require this connection, tap “Delete connection” to remove.
deletepending.secondchecktitle: Are you sure you want to delete this connection?

details.label: Label

details.nocurrentnotesext: There are currently no notes associated with this connection.
details.title: Title

deleteconnection.title: Are you sure you want to delete this connection?

deletenote.title: Are you sure you want to delete this note?

details.clouderror:
We couldn’t locate this connection in the cloud. It might become available again soon, but some information could be lost.

If you no longer require this connection, tap “Delete connection” to remove.

choice.title: Would you like to see your password hint or reset your password?

verifypasscode.title: Enter passcode
verifypasscode.description: Please enter your passcode to verify

text.verify: If you've forgotten your passcode, please verify your recovery phrase to gain access to your wallet
text.restart: You currently haven't generated a recovery phrase, would you like to start your onboarding again?

passcode.title: Forgot passcode
passcode.description: Please verify your recovery phrase to reset your passcode. To start typing click on the first option.

password.title: Forgot password
password.description: Please verify your recovery phrase to reset your password. To start typing click on the first option.

newpasscode.title: New passcode
newpasscode.description: Create a new passcode to re-secure your wallet and perform operations

newpassword.title: New password
newpassword.description: Create a new operations password so you can access additional wallet features.

subtitle.identifier: To share, either scan the QR code or select from the provided options below
subtitle.connection: Show this QR code to the person you want to connect with, or click the 'More share options' link

notes.top: Before proceeding, please make sure that everyone you want to include as a signer scans this QR code.
notes.middle: After everyone has scanned your QR code, please be sure to scan everyone else's QR code as well.
notes.bottom: To continue with the initiation of the group identifier you must have scanned at least one other QR code.

scanalert.text: Have all the individuals you want to include as members scanned your QR code?

pending.bottom: Check back later or contact support if it persists.

notes.top: Before proceeding, please make sure everyone included as a member scans this QR code.
notes.middle: Remember to scan everyone else’s QR code too!

connections.title: Connections
connections.subtitle: These are the members you scanned. Please review before proceeding.

threshold.title: Set a Threshold
threshold.subtitle: Set the threshold to determine the level of consensus required
threshold.label: Threshold

confirm.title: Confirm
confirm.subtitle: Confirm all details for your group identifier are accurate

alert.text: Cancelling now means you'll need to restart the group initiation process.

displayname.title: Display name
displayname.placeholder: Create a name for this identifier

aidinfo.title: Identifier types
aidinfo.text: A description of each type you can create identifiers for.

individual.label: Individual
individual.text: Use these identifiers to represent all your individual personas. Currently, a single key pair is used to sign statements with these identifiers, and it can be updated. In the future, these identifiers might become more robust with multi-device support and social recovery options.

group.label: Group
group.text: Use a group identifier to represent an entity controlled by multiple people, like a committee. You can set a threshold to decide how many members are needed to create a valid signature or recover the identifier.

delegated.label: Delegated
delegated.text: The delegated option is currently being developed. Identifiers might be delegated for advanced recovery in case of a security breach, which is ideal for an organisational structure in enterprises.

error.maxlength: Must be less than 32 characters long

offline.title: You’re offline
offline.description: You’ve lost connection to the cloud agent. Once the connection has been re-established your wallet will return to normal usage.

toast.usernamecreationerror: Unable to set name. Please try again.
toast.groupidnotmatcherror: Connection not part of this group

title.username: Welcome! What should we call you?
title.connectionalias: It looks like your new connection doesn't have a name yet. Let's give them one!

nameerror.maxlength: You have reached the 32 character limit
nameerror.hasspecialchar: Only use letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), underscores (_) and hyphens (-)
nameerror.duplicatename: Must not be a name already in use

biometry.setupbiometryheader: Do you want to allow “Veridian” to use biometrics?
biometry.cancelbiometryheader: You canceled Biometrics. You can set this up later via the settings page.

genericerror.text: Something went wrong. Please try again.

nowitnesserror.text: Your SSI agent is misconfigured. For additional information, contact your SSI Cloud Agent provider.

systemcompatibility.title: Operating system outdated
systemcompatibility.description: Your device's operating system does not meet the minimum requirements for secure data storage. To protect your information, update is required.

systemthreats.title: Threats Detected
systemthreats.description: The following security threats have been detected on your device.
systemthreats.initerror: Security module initialization failed. Critical protections are not active, leaving the application vulnerable.
systemthreats.alert: Security threats detected. Please resolve the issues listed, then close and reopen the app to continue.

rules.privilegedaccess: Detects if the app is running with elevated permissions, such as root access on Android or jailbroken status on iOS.
rules.debug: Indicates whether the app is running in debug mode, which may expose sensitive information and make reverse engineering easier.
rules.simulator: Detects if the app is running in a simulated environment (emulator/simulator), which is often used for testing and can pose security risks.
rules.appintegrity: Verifies if the app's code or resources have been tampered with or modified, which could indicate unauthorized alterations or potential malware injection.
rules.unofficialstore: Detects whether the app was installed from an unverified or third-party app store, which may increase the risk of malware and unauthorized modifications.
rules.hooks: Identifies attempts to hook or manipulate the app's runtime behavior, which is a common technique used by attackers to intercept and modify functionality.
rules.devicebinding: Ensures that the app is tied to a specific device to prevent unauthorized access from different devices, enhancing security against cloning and unauthorized installations.
rules.securehardwarenotavailable: Indicates that secure hardware features, such as a secure enclave or trusted execution environment (TEE), are unavailable. While this may be tolerable in some cases, it can reduce security.
rules.obfuscationissues: Indicates potential issues with code obfuscation, which is a security measure used to protect the app's code from reverse engineering. Lack of proper obfuscation increases security risks, especially on Android.
rules.developermode: Detects if the device has developer mode enabled, which may indicate an increased risk of debugging or modification attempts, particularly on Android.
rules.adbenabled: Indicates whether Android Debug Bridge (ADB) is enabled on the device, which can allow unauthorized access or debugging of the app.
rules.deviceid: Ensures that the device ID remains consistent. Unexpected changes in the device ID may indicate a security risk, such as device cloning or manipulation.
